content.question:
Consider the following code segment.

firstList <math alttext="← " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ["guitar", "drums", "bass"]
secondList <math alttext="← " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ["flute", "violin"]
thirdList <math alttext="← " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> []
thirdList <math alttext="← " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> firstList
firstList <math alttext="← " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> secondList
secondList <math alttext="← " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> thirdList
What are the contents of secondList after the code segment is executed?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Use abstraction to manage complexity in a program.
